hero.title: SEO Showcase
hero.subtitle: Meta tags, Open Graph, JSON-LD, Sitemap and more
hero.description: See how this portfolio was optimized for search engines — with examples for Next.js and pure React (Vite). Each technique is running in production.

overview.title: What was implemented
overview.description: Complete SEO infrastructure with examples for Next.js (native APIs) and React + Vite (community libraries).

items.title: Metadata API
items.description: Title template, description, keywords, authors, robots and canonical URL configured in the root layout with automatic inheritance for all pages.

items.title: Open Graph & Twitter Cards
items.description: 1200x630 image dynamically generated via ImageResponse with avatar, name, skills and site branding.

items.title: JSON-LD Structured Data
items.description: Person, WebSite, ProfilePage and BreadcrumbList schemas with @id cross-referencing — Google rich snippets with name, job title, skills and navigation.

items.title: Dynamic Sitemap
items.description: Automatically generated from routes registered in content.ts. New pages enter the sitemap without manual configuration.

items.title: Robots.txt
items.description: Crawling configuration allowing full indexation and pointing to sitemap.xml.

items.title: PWA Manifest
items.description: Web App Manifest with name, theme colors, icons and standalone configuration for mobile installation.

metadata.title: Metadata API
metadata.description: The root layout defines global metadata with title template. Child pages inherit and can override via buildPageMetadata().

ogImage.title: Open Graph Image
ogImage.description: Image generated at build time via next/og ImageResponse. Appears when the link is shared on LinkedIn, Twitter, WhatsApp or Slack.

jsonLd.title: JSON-LD Structured Data
jsonLd.description: Schema.org @graph with Person, WebSite, ProfilePage and BreadcrumbList — all linked via @id. This allows Google to understand the author, site navigation and display rich snippets.

sitemap.title: Sitemap & Robots
sitemap.description: The sitemap is dynamically generated from the CONTENT_ITEMS array. When a new page is added to content.ts, it automatically appears in sitemap.xml.

icons.title: Icons & PWA
icons.description: Favicon (32x32) and Apple Touch Icon (180x180) generated via ImageResponse with VB initials. The manifest.webmanifest configures the app for PWA installation.

comparison.title: Next.js vs React + Vite
comparison.description: SEO works differently in SSR/SSG apps (Next.js) and SPAs (React + Vite). See how to handle each item in both scenarios.

checklist.description: Status of each SEO item implemented in this portfolio.

webVitals.title: Core Web Vitals
webVitals.description: Performance metrics that Google uses as a ranking factor. Monitored in this portfolio via Vercel Speed Insights.

items.name: Largest Contentful Paint
items.description: Time until the largest visible element loads. Ideal: < 2.5s.
items.tip: Optimize images with next/image, use fonts with display: swap and prioritize above-the-fold content.

items.name: Interaction to Next Paint
items.description: Response time to user interactions. Ideal: < 200ms.
items.tip: Avoid long main thread tasks, use React.memo, useCallback and code splitting with dynamic imports.

items.name: Cumulative Layout Shift
items.description: How much the layout shifts unexpectedly. Ideal: < 0.1.
items.tip: Set width/height on images, use font-display: swap and reserve space for dynamic content.

items.name: First Contentful Paint
items.description: Time until the first content appears on screen. Ideal: < 1.8s.
items.tip: Use SSR/SSG, minimize critical CSS, avoid render-blocking scripts and inline critical CSS.

items.name: Time to First Byte
items.description: Time until the server responds. Ideal: < 800ms.
items.tip: Use CDN (Vercel Edge), cache static pages, optimize server queries and use ISR when possible.

webVitals.monitorTip: Tip: use Vercel Speed Insights or Google PageSpeed Insights to monitor in production.
